games

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Mastermind, MoreLess

    public abstract class Game
extends Object
    Game is the class representing a game.

    The games represented by the Game class are games where it is necessary to discover either a number (MoreLess game) or a combination of number or color (mastermind)

    A game is initiated by starting with the game mode provided as a constructor's parameter (call of the play methods playChallenger() playDefender() playDuel())
    A game can generate a mystery number mysteryNumberGeneration(int)
    A game can compare a proposal provided with the mystery number compareNumber(List, List)
    A game can initiate a message of victory or defeat victory() defeat(List)
    Version:
    1.0.11
    Author:
    BRUCELLA2

      • compareNumber

        public abstract String compareNumber(List<Integer> pNumberToCompare,
                                     List<Integer> pMysteryNumber)
        This method allows to compare the number proposed in the parameter with the mystery number

        This method is redefined in the different girls' classes.
        Parameters:
        pNumberToCompare - The number to be compared to the mystery number.
        pMysteryNumber - The mystery Number.
        Returns:
        The result of the comparison in the form of a String

      • computerTurn

        protected abstract List<Integer> computerTurn(ComputerPlayer pComputerPlayer,
                                              List<Integer> pMysteryNumber)
        When it's the computer turn in a game, this method need to be called to performed the operation needed. All game in CombineGame need to give a proposition. This proposition is returned.
        Parameters:
        pComputerPlayer - The computer player
        pMysteryNumber - The mystery number to discover
        Returns:
        The proposition of the computer player

      • defeat

        protected void defeat(List<Integer> pMysteryNumber)
        This method is used to end the game by indicating that the player has lost.
        The message is "Dommage ! Vous avez perdu" followed by the correct answer unless the game mode is the defender.
        Parameters:
        pMysteryNumber - The mystery Number not discovered during the game

      • equality

        protected void equality()
        This method is used to end the game by indicating an equality between the player and the computer.
        This message is "Personne n'a gagné"

      • humanTurn

        protected abstract List<Integer> humanTurn(HumanPlayer pHumanPlayer,
                                           List<Integer> pMysteryNumber)
        When it's the human turn in a game, this method need to be called to performed the operation needed. All game in CombineGame need to give a proposition. This proposition is returned.
        Parameters:
        pHumanPlayer - The human player
        pMysteryNumber - The mystery number to discover
        Returns:
        The proposition of the human player

      • mysteryNumberGeneration

        public List<Integer> mysteryNumberGeneration(int pMaxValueDigit)
        This method generates a mystery number.

        This method is based on the number of mystery digits that constitue the mystery number.
        The generated digits are integers between 0 and 9.
        Parameters:
        pMaxValueDigit - The max value of each digit
        Returns:
        The mystery Number generated
